snippet: After an attack that killed 16 Egyptian soldiers, a crossing was closed, then severely restricted, preventing many Gazans from going to Mecca during Ramadan.
abstract: Gazans are unable to make their annual pilgrimage to Mecca this Ramadan because exits through the Rafah crossing to Egypt are restricted after August 5 attack nearby that killed 16 Egyptian solders.
lead_paragraph: After an attack that killed 16 Egyptian soldiers, a crossing was closed, then severely restricted, preventing many Gazans from going to Mecca during Ramadan.

headline.seo: Rafah Crossing Closed, Curbing Gazans’ Chances for Hajj
headline.main: A Gaza Border Slams Shut, and With It, Chances for a Pilgrimage to Mecca
headline.print_headline: A Gaza Border Slams Shut, and With It, Chances for a Pilgrimage to Mecca
